intro: Tricoryne anceps subsp. pterocaulon, commonly known as the narrow-leafed tricoryne, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers arranged in composite heads. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
